subject: Economics
title: Climate Change: The World's Biggest Prisoner's Dilemma
description: A quick win: understand Climate Change: The World's Biggest Prisoner's Dilemma.

hook.text: 195 countries agreed to the Paris Accord. No country is meeting its targets.

buildup.text: Climate action is a global Prisoner's Dilemma. Cutting emissions is costly for each country.

discovery.text: Each country reasons: if others cut emissions, I don't need to. If others won't cut, my cuts are meaningless.

twist.text: Unlike the one-shot Prisoner's Dilemma, climate is a repeated game.

climax.text: Solving climate change requires the same thing that solves any Prisoner's Dilemma.

punchline.text: Climate change isn't a technology problem. It's a game theory problem.

quiz.question: Why is climate change action structured like a Prisoner's Dilemma?
options: Each country benefits from free-riding on others' emissions cuts, making inaction individually rational even though cooperation benefits all
